pros: Most professors are incredibly kind and trust you

review_title: Friendly co-workers but salary and change adverse environment don't make it worth it
pros:
- Friendly co-workers

- Excellent manager

- Access to gym facilities for free with employee ID
cons:
- Salary is not competitive for the level of work that is expected. Using the phrase "but you get to work at WHEATON" is not an excuse for low pay especially for the high cost of living in the Chicagoland area. 

- Job descriptions and job expectations do not often match. Much more is expected than what is originally offered through the job description. This causes discontent and frustration.

- The change adverse environment was stifling. Wheaton has so many areas to improve upon and intelligent people with the capacity to make the changes but the overall culture is one of fear of change.

review_title: Extremely Supportive, Holistic, and Encouraging Work Environment
pros: Really good-hearted people, all the way across the institution. I have worked in many divisions and can attest. Work practice really takes whole person into account. Explicitly Christian expectations for work behavior, and even lifestyle to an extent. Brilliant people in every corner. Tons of interesting things to do because of arts & entertainment; lectures; seminars. Amazing benefits package, including a 2-for-1 matching on retirement.
cons: Non-profit means great mission, and lower pay scale. Things move a bit slowly because of educational life-cycle, and a large part of community disappears over summer. Outside of faculty path, career development opportunities are hard to come by.

review_title: Good place to work in the summer
pros: Guaranteed 40 hours a week if you want them; time off when you need it; and great people to work with. The foremen are excellent and understanding - they are willing to work with your schedules if you let them know ahead of time. The work can be tough some days, but usually it is very manageable and reasonable. Fun people to work with and a great work environment
cons: Pay is not excellent per hour, but you can make more in the long run because you are getting 40 hours a week. Can get somewhat slow and monotonous, but what job doesn't from time to time.

review_title: It's more than just a job.
job_title: Manager of Annual Giving Programs in Wheaton, IL
pros: Some of the pros of working at a place like Wheaton College is the mission you are behind when you choose to work there. The students are what it is about and what they will be doing 1, 5, 10, and 30 years down the road. You believe that they will be making a difference and doing incredible things in their lifetime.
cons: If I could summarize the "con" of working here, it is that things are out of date and not with the times. That falls into the areas of collaboration, innovation, employee engagement, management development, etc.

pros: Working as a T.A. provides many opportunities to get to know the professors and other staff. Professors are always fair to the students with regard to both number of hours and flexibility.
cons: Communication between departments and between the departments and lower-level employees, such as the T.A.'s, isn't always the best. You have to be diligent in trying to connect with employees in order to get sufficient feedback and/or get assigned to something new once an old project is completed.

pros:
Tuition benefits for employees.
14 Holidays/year including the week of Christmas to new years
Two weeks of vacation
Uber confusing multi-tiered health insurance plan is better than nothing.
2 to 1 match on 403b up to max of 8%
cons: Upper management in facilities misuses Matthew 18. HR tells me this is common in other departments as well. Matthew 18 is used in retaliation against employees reporting issues to HR. A real example: an employee reports their supervisor and coworker to HR for sexual harassment of a minor, management says the employee was wrong to report the incident to HR because of Matthew 18.

review_title: College Post Office is a Good Place for Students to Work
job_title: Part Time Package Handler in Wheaton, IL
pros: I didn't have to worry about class times conflicting with my work schedule because every semester we would email our boss with our class schedule and she would assign our shifts based on that. I was always assigned to work almost exactly the number of hours per week that I said I wanted to work.
cons: We were not allowed to get raises, even though students working elsewhere on campus could get raises. I didn't mind too much that I was paid minimum wage, though, because the job tasks were fairly easy.

review_title: Awesome leadership structure, clearly outlined salary track.
pros: I worked in two different positions but had the same pay scale, so when I was promoted to super in one job, I got paid at the higher rate at both jobs. My faculty supervisors were all respectful of students' schedules. While no one took any guff, they were willing to give you the benefit of the doubt.
cons: You're never going to get off campus. The pay isn't amazing, especially the first year you start. You're probably going to be supervised by other students, which can be good or bad, depending.

pros: There are many opportunities to learn and grow in this environment. The intellectual community is stimulating and colleagues are approachable.
cons: The community is quite broad in it's perspectives and there can be divisions across functional lines, for instance between faculty and staff.

pros: My supervisor is understanding of my keeping a flexible schedule, as long as I get in my hours and get the job done.
cons: Compared to working for a corporation, pay is low.  Wheaton is not-for-profit, so this is understandable, but most employees could make more elsewhere.

pros: Fun and interesting place to work; nice work environment and beautiful campus.  Alumnae are very tight with their alma mater as a generalization and students are great - top administration are wonderful.  Benefits are generous and you get a week off between Christmas and New Years, but give up the one day holidays during the school year.
cons: Not every building has elevators due to the historic nature of the campus.

review_title: Lovely place and great staff and administrators
pros: Great benefits if you love a Christ centered education for your kids. Safe place to raise kids and great educational experience for your kids definitely
cons: Wheaton area is expensive and salary is low compared to its peers in the field. Staff and faculty morale can be affected by the negative press coverage at times

pros: My co-workers and supervisors were all incredibly friendly and very supportive - they wanted to see me succeed and gave me the tools to do so.
cons: The structuring of the organization is vertical, not allowing for enough cross-disciplinary engagement and sharing. The top-down approach could be reworked.

review_title: Academic and Institutional Technology Student Event Tech
job_title: Student Event Tech III in Wheaton, IL
pros: This has been a fantastic student job all four years at Wheaton. I have received good training and have had opportunities to grow as an employee. The team is fun and the work is enjoyable. Also, the sizable raises in the past year were very appreciated.
cons: Hours are not very consistent, and scheduling is a bit cumbersome since it is all managed via email.

pros:
Good benefits
Great work environment
Christian community
Intellectual culture
Access to facilities like the dining hall and the sports and recreation complex
Great on-campus events are free or discounted
cons:
Salary is lower
The college does not provide robust or consistent training for employees in management positions
There is very little vertical movement once someone starts: don't count on making a career here

job_title: Medical Shuttle Driver in Wheaton, IL
pros: The staff at the Student Health Services building is so kind. I greatly enjoyed sharing a workspace with them. As well as the staff, nearly all the patients I transported made my time at this job memorable.
cons: On full days, I could be driving for hours on end without a break. This job requires the endurance to drive safely for multiple hours at a time.

review_title: An incredible opportunity to work with some of the best people out there.
job_title: Athletic Promotions Manager in Wheaton, IL
pros: The people make the job--naturally bright (It's Wheaton!) and full of integrity, going to work everyday is an awesome experience.
cons: Pay is not stellar--ask anyone why they work here- it's never for the money; this also means everyone is here because they want to be-which is great!

pros: Collegiality among employees within organization.  Love the college environment.  Exposure to great cultural experiences with discount.  Generous number of holidays.
cons: Wish more full time jobs were available, but understand benefits are a big line item in budget.  Students are respected.  A great thing.

pros: Faculty were very willing to assist with any questions I had. Support staff was very friendly and helpful as well. The atmosphere is very friendly and easy going. This was a great first teaching experience.
cons: There is limited instrumentation available, but they do make good use of what they have.

pros: Faculty and Staff are motivated by the mission of the college, Managers are usually "relational" rather than "directive", Many people interact outside of work through church groups and other programs
cons: Since Wheaton is a leading Liberal Arts college there is some hesitance to use IT in a strategic manner

pros: They changed the rules and let adults drink responsibly if they wanted too.
cons: After 10 years of employment and an alum, I was laid off, asked to sign a contract to never speak of the release agreement. I didn't sign it. They wanted to give me one month's salary in exchange for this.

pros: Hard-working, smart, and friendly colleagues!
cons: Multiple teaching preps in the early years (i.e., new course designs), many departments need to handle conflict more constructively instead of turning toward hostile and/or passively aggressive behaviors (college is aware of this and has been starting to work on this with specific teams).

job_title: Museum Operations Supervisor in Wheaton, IL
pros: Valuable experience in customer service and opportunities to take on greater responsibilities. The museum manager will offer you important feedback and offer you opportunities based on your specific skill-set.
cons: Only part time, only employs students enrolled in Wheaton College

cons: -Pay and raises for student jobs are automatic and non-negotiable

pros: In the bookstore, the manager and others were kind and created a family atmosphere.
cons: Truthfully, not cons for a clerk position like this. Was great experience and money for a high school student.

pros: Flexible with students who have odd schedules, reasonable compensation considering this job could be mostly an apprenticeship.
cons: None that I can think of.

pros: Great place to work.  Good life work balance.

pros: Fast-paced, friendly, genuine and challenging. I love working here.

pros: People are nice. Maybe too nice.
